set_net_info.description: The first octet of the IP address is placed in the least significant byte of the u32. For example, the IP address 192.168.2.2 would be packed into a u32 like this: u32 ip = (192) | (168 << 8) | (2 << 16) | (2 << 24);

payload.description: IP address of NTP server.
payload.name: ntp_ip_address

payload.description: Subnet of NTP server.
payload.name: subnet_mask

payload.description: Gateway IP address of NTP server. Only necessary if NTP server is in different subnet than device and needs to be accessed through a gateway. Otherwise can be left as 0
payload.name: gateway_ip

set_ping_parameters.description: Used to control the operation of Surveyor

payload.description: Start range in mm at which echo data is recorded. Ignored in auto range mode. Will be forced to 5% of end range as a minimum.
payload.name: start_mm

payload.description: End range in mm over which echo data is recorded. Set to 0 for Surveyor to automatically track the bottom and adjust range dynamically.
payload.name: end_mm

payload.description: Speed of sound
payload.name: sos_mps

payload.description: Set to -1 for auto gain (recommended). Valid manual gain ranges are from 0 to 100
payload.name: gain_index

payload.description: pings per second = 1000 / msec_per_ping. So 100 msec_per_ping means 10 pings per second. Actual ping rate can be limited by range and speed of sound, so the value specified defines an upper limit on ping rate.
payload.name: msec_per_ping

payload.description: Set to 0
payload.name: deprecated

payload.description: must be set to 0
payload.name: diagnostic_injected_signal

payload.description: true to start/continue pinging, false to stop
payload.name: ping_enable

payload.description: Used by SonarView, but not necessary. If enabled log files will be much larger.
payload.name: enable_channel_data

payload.description: Must be set to false
payload.name: reserved_for_raw_data

payload.description: Angle and time of flight data is preferred for future SonarView enhancements.
payload.name: enable_yz_point_data

payload.description: Enable angle and time of flight information for each detected point
payload.name: enable_atof_data

payload.description: Set to 240000. Used for internal production testing only
payload.name: target_ping_hz

payload.description: Sets range resolution in number of range steps. Must be between 200 and 800 (inclusive)
payload.name: n_range_steps

payload.description: Pulse length in number of range steps. Recommended value is 1.5
payload.name: pulse_len_steps

atof_point_data.description: A response packet Surveyor sends to the host application containing angle and time of flight for each detected point.

payload.description: Time at start of ping, msec since power on.
payload.name: pwr_up_msec

payload.description: Time at start of ping, utc msec (1970 epoc). Will be 0 if not avaliable.
payload.name: utc_msec

payload.description: Time from start of ping to last range bin.
payload.name: listening_sec

payload.description: Speed of sound (mps) used in angle calculations.
payload.name: sos_mps

payload.description: Assigned sequentially from power on.
payload.name: ping_number

payload.description: Frequency of the ping signal (Hz).
payload.name: ping_hz

payload.description: Pulse length in seconds.
payload.name: pulse_sec

payload.description: reserved
payload.name: flags

payload.description: Number of points reported in the points field
payload.name: num_points

attitude_report.description: A response packet Surveyor sends to the host application containing information about the attitude (pitch and roll) of the device based on it's internal sensors.

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_x

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_y

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_z

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: reserved_1

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: reserved_2

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: reserved_3

payload.description: utc msec (1970 epoc). Will be 0 if not avaliable
payload.name: utc_msec

payload.description: msec since power up
payload.name: pwr_up_msec

water_stats.description: A response packet Surveyor sends to the host application containing information about the temperature and pressure of the water.

yz_point_data.description: A response packet that Surveyor sends to the host application containing the detected depth points.

payload.description: msec since power up
payload.name: timestamp_msec

payload.description: Assigned sequentially from power on.
payload.name: ping_number

payload.description: Speed of sound
payload.name: sos_mps

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_x

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_y

payload.description: World up vector (x, y, z) in the device coordinate system (x forward, y port, z up)
payload.name: up_vec_z

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: mag_vec_x

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: mag_vec_y

payload.description: reserved for future magnetic field vector
payload.name: mag_vec_z

payload.description: -1000 if sensor not installed
payload.name: water_degC

payload.description: Water pressure in bar. -1000 if sensor not installed
payload.name: water_bar

payload.description: Reserved for heave in meters.
payload.name: heave_m

payload.description: Range at the beginning of the analyzed signals for this ping.
payload.name: start_m

payload.description: Range at the end of the analyzed signals for this ping.
payload.name: end_m

payload.description: Number of points reported in the points field
payload.name: num_points

payload.description: Y and Z value pairs for each detected point. Y is athwartships offset in meters, positive to the port side. Z is depth, positive up so all z values will be negative.
payload.name: yz_point_data
